meanings.definition: To support or strengthen with joists.
meanings.sent1: The carpenters joisted the floor to make it strong.
meanings.sent2: They joisted the ceiling to ensure it wouldn't collapse.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to joist the toy bone with sticks.
meanings.sent4: She joisted her confidence with positive affirmations.
meanings.sent5: The ancient castle was joisted with sturdy beams to withstand time.

meanings.definition: To fit or furnish with joists.
meanings.sent1: The workers joisted the new door frame carefully.
meanings.sent2: He joisted the shelves in place for the books.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to joist the ingredients together in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her smile joisted the room with warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The garden was joisted with wooden borders to define the paths.

meanings.definition: To build or construct with joists.
meanings.sent1: The team joisted the platform for the stage performance.
meanings.sent2: They joisted the framework for the new house.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to joist a fort out of pillows and blankets.
meanings.sent4: His words joisted a bridge between the two conflicting parties.
meanings.sent5: The artist joisted the sculpture with intricate details and care.
